definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The inside and outside of the vessel were smoothed and red ochre slip was applied.
sentences.chinese: 内部和外部的船只进行平滑和红色赭石采用滑动。

sentences.english: Blue Whale my back was light blue, belly full of folds, with ocher color macula.
sentences.chinese: 蓝鲸背脊呈浅蓝色，肚皮布满褶皱，带有赭石色黄斑。

sentences.english: In truth it's the 9)ocher in the hillsides that has painted the town red.
sentences.chinese: 而事实上是山坡上的赭石将整个小镇染成了红色。

sentences.english: Many Russia scholars believe ochre petroglyph were at the same age as slab-stone tombs'.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯学者普遍认为赭石岩画与石板墓的年代相当。

sentences.english: This jade is reddish brown in colour.
Inside the cave, the artisans chipped and crushed the soft ocher stones.
sentences.chinese: 在洞穴内，工匠们打凿并碾碎这些软赭石。

definition: relief shading (in a picture)/fig. to throw into relief
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
cinnabar/mercuric sulfide HgS/also written 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]
inked line/carpenter's straight line marker (an inked cord stretched tight then lowered onto timber)
mother-of-pearl (used in ornamentation and in TCM)
orpiment/arsenic trisulfide As2S3/make changes in writing/malign/criticize without grounds
